questions.question_text: A network engineer must perform a VMM integration for the VMWare vCenter platform with the Cisco ACI Fabric. The vCenter is already installed in one of the rack servers connected to ACI leaf switches in a vPC mode. Which type of management network must be used to integrate vCenter with ACI?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Before you create a VMM domain profile, you must establish connectivity to external network using in-band management network on the APIC.
https://www.cisco.com/c/dam/m/en_us/solutions/data-center-virtualization/application-centric-infrastructure/aci-virtualization-guide-chapter.pdf

I'll go with B, APIC Infra. 

APIC Infra Network: The Cisco Application Policy Infrastructure Controller (APIC) provides centralized management for the ACI fabric. The APIC uses an infrastructure network to manage and communicate with various ACI components, including the VMware vCenter, which is integrated with the ACI fabric. The APIC infra network is dedicated to management and control plane communications within the ACI fabric, ensuring that ACI and VMware vCenter can exchange information such as policies, network configurations, and virtual machine (VM) management tasks.

questions.question_text: A customer needs a design for a new network. VLANs must be dynamically provisioned based on the information received from connected hosts. No Layer 2 or Layer 3 configuration must be performed on the related switch ports. Which feature must be used?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/switches/datacenter/nexus9000/sw/93x/vm-tracker/configuration/guide/b-cisco-nexus-9000-nx-os-virtual-machine-tracker-configuration-guide-93x/b-cisco-nexus-9000-nx-os-virtual-machine-tracker-configuration-guide-93x_chapter_011.html

This example shows how to enable dynamic VLAN creation:

switch# configure terminal
switch(config)# vmtracker connection conn1
switch(config-vmt-conn)# autovlan enable

I'll go with A.

Plug and Play (PnP) allows network devices, such as switches, to automatically receive configuration settings (like VLANs) based on the information provided by connected devices (hosts). This is done through centralized management tools, ensuring that no manual configuration is needed on the switch ports. When a device is connected to a network, PnP allows it to automatically be assigned the appropriate network settings based on pre-defined templates or profiles.

questions.question_text: An engineer must design a Cisco SAN environment between two data centers for backup and replication purposes. The data centers are separated by 510 kilometers and are interconnected via a 16-Gbps WAN/MAN link. Which topology must be used to interconnect the data centers?

discussion.content:

Both the main forwarding path and the redundant backup path must have been installed within Border Gateway Protocol (BGP), and BGP must support lossless switchover between operational paths.
